intro: Pimpinella limprichtii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant features slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a finely toothed margin. It is typically found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
